links.name: I write some blogs here and there...

milestones.title: Achievement Unlocked: Hello World!
milestones.description: I remember writing Hello World in HTML on my family's THICK Dell Inspiron laptop (I was 9 years old ü•π), I was so excited to see something on the webpage which was made by me...good times ü•π

milestones.title: Achievement Unlocked: Cringey projects
milestones.description: On that laptop and in my school, I started making some REALLY bad sign up forms, login forms, landing pages, etc. I wish I had those projects with me to reflect upon my journey but all of my old projects are lost forever üôÅ

milestones.title: Started Learning Responsive Web Design through FreeCodeCamp
milestones.description: Yup, it took me 3 whole years to complete this course, honestly speaking I was just not consistent and I was exploring many other fields in computer science like arduino, game development, mobile development, backend web development with Django, learning C++, etc.

milestones.title: Uploaded my first ever Tkinter project to GitHub
milestones.description: This was my first ever GitHub repository and the first ever fully functional application I made with Tkinter (please don't look at the code, its awful üòÖ)

milestones.title: Made a drone with my friends
milestones.description: There was a robotics club in my school and this was the first ever project that me and my friends made together (It's the big one in the middle)

milestones.title: Crossed 100 Followers on Twitter
milestones.description: Started focusing on my Twitter account and growing connections and honing my skills

milestones.title: Learned JavaScript from Udemy
milestones.description: After years of exploring, finally decided to go into web development

milestones.title: Learning Full Stack Web Development from The Odin Project
milestones.description: I am sharing my journey on my Twitter (@zaidahmad25), so you can check it out if you wish üòÉ
